p: The aim of this study was to experimentally test in vivo the effects of a changed growing environment on E. polonica infected Norway spruce seedlings, comparing current ambient conditions (for the year 2015) to projected temperature and CO 2 levels for the years 2030 and 2100 in Finland ( Jylh√§ et al., 2004, 2009). Previous research has demonstrated that seedlings provide an effective model for larger tree health within this system ( Krokene and Solheim, 1998; Repe et al., 2015). Due to the general inability of this tree species to adjust to environmental changes, we hypothesized that disease severity on seedlings would be greater under predicted future climate change scenarios than current ambient conditions.
